tasks.task: Addressing the decision to terminate employment legally and professionally
subtasks: Verify state employment laws (at-will, protected classes)
Document performance issues and provide feedback
Prepare termination notice (when, who, how)
Handle final payment and return of company property
Provide limited reference to future employers

tasks.task: Addressing the decision to terminate employment legally and professionally
subtasks: Check if the state is an at-will employment state.

Ensure termination isn't based on protected classes like race, color, religion, etc. (Though the transcript mentions Vermont and New Hampshire have additional protections for age, sexual orientation, etc.)
Document any performance issues and provide prior feedback.
Keep records of any discussions or issues noticed over time.
Arrange a private meeting.
Have another supervisor present to support.
Deliver the news clearly but concisely.
Explain the reasons (e.g., persistent tardiness) and stick to the decision.
Have the employee sign time cards for partial payment.
Pay any owed wages within the state-specific window (72 hours in Vermont and New Hampshire).
Recover company property (keys, tools, etc.).
Provide a signed receipt for returned items.
Give the final paycheck.
Walk the employee to their car or assist with transportation if needed.
If necessary, handle any concerning behaviors by involving law enforcement.
Agree to limited reference given upon request.
Refrain from disclosing the reason for termination unless specifically asked.
